p: The extraction of phenolic compounds was performed according to Denev et al. [ 39]. Before extraction and analysis, samples were milled in a laboratory mill to fine powder. Briefly, approximately 0.5 g of the M. frivaldszkyana powder were weighted accurately, transferred to an extraction tube and mixed with 40 mL 60% ethanol, v/ v. Samples were extracted at room temperature on a magnetic stirrer for 1 h. After that, extracts were filtered and centrifuged (6000Ã— g, 20 min) and supernatants were further used for antioxidant activity determination and analyses of phenolic compounds.
